poem:
### Echoes of Jenin

In dust-choked alleys, shadows scatter,  
as whispers of mortar punctuate silence.  
Promises and protests hang heavy;  
graves dug by sunlit hands await moons.  
Refugees see stars through cracked roofs,  
futures chiseled in stone and bone,  
where borders bar and children echo  
through the night, unanswered cries.  
Peace, an orphaned dream, adrift.
